info.title: Calling Platform API
info.description: Multi-tenant Twilio calling platform — per-agent dedicated numbers, realtime transcription, GCS recording storage, Groq AI analysis

post.description:
Login with email + password. Organization slug is OPTIONAL.
- Platform admins: no org needed
- Regular users: org is auto-detected from user record
- If the same email exists in multiple orgs, pass organization_slug to disambiguate

get.description: Render the set-password form for invited users.

post.description: Process initial password set from invite link.

get.description: Verify email address via token link.

post.description: Request a password reset email.
Process password reset.

Resend invite email to a user who hasn't set their password yet.
Available to org-admin or above (checked in admin routes, but also callable directly).

get.description: Generate a Twilio Access Token for the Twilio Device (Client SDK).

post.description:
Agent periodically calls this to signal presence.
Updates Redis TTL. If TTL expires, agent is auto-considered offline.

Create agent with an automatically purchased dedicated Twilio number.
If Twilio purchase fails → agent creation fails (transactional guarantee).
If DB save fails → purchased number is released immediately.

Bulk import agents from CSV/XLSX.
Each valid row triggers an individual Twilio number purchase.
If number purchase fails for a row → that row is marked failed.
Other rows continue processing.

delete.description:
Supervisor deletes an agent.
Releases the agent's Twilio number (with async retry on failure).

get.description: Get stream_sid and call details for a given call_sid (used by frontend for inbound calls).

post.description:
Terminate a call for BOTH parties via Twilio REST API.

When agent clicks "End Call", this endpoint:
1. Calls Twilio API to set call status to 'completed' → both legs hang up
2. Updates DB with disconnect_reason = 'agent'
3. Sets call status to COMPLETED

Initiate an outbound call via Twilio REST API.

Flow (Conference-based):
1. twilio.calls.create(to=destination) → destination answers →
   TwiML: <Stream> + <Dial><Conference call-{stream_sid}>
2. add_agent_to_conference() → Agent's Device rings → auto-accepts
3. Both parties are in the conference — call bridged

schema.title: Response Get My Calls Calls My Calls Get

get.description: Get call statistics: totals, durations, and today's counts.

Get full call details including:
- Fresh 7-day signed GCS URL for recording playback
- Full transcript
- AI summary
- Sentiment analysis

Call recording is served from GCS (not Twilio).

patch.description: Update notes and tags on a call record.

post.description:
Pause Twilio recording AND live transcription for an active call.

- Twilio stops saving audio to the recording file
- STT handler stops processing audio chunks (transcript paused)
- Call stays connected — agent and customer can still talk
- Can be resumed with POST /{call_sid}/resume-recording

Resume a paused Twilio recording AND live transcription.

- Twilio resumes saving audio to the same recording file
- STT handler resumes processing audio chunks
- The gap during the pause is NOT in the final recording

Put the customer on hold.
Customer hears hold music. Agent hears silence.
Uses Conference participant hold API.

Take the customer off hold.
Call resumes normally — both parties can hear each other.

Record who disconnected the call.

Called by the frontend after the call ends to report
whether the agent or the customer initiated the disconnect.

Accepted values for reason: "agent", "customer", "system", "unknown"

schema.title: Response List Voicemails Supervisor Voicemails Get

get.description: Return all active call states from Redis (realtime data).

schema.title: Response Get Live Calls Supervisor Live Calls Get

get.description: Return TwiML that says 'Recording has been paused.' — used by announce_url.
Return TwiML that says 'Recording has been resumed.' — used by announce_url.

Return TwiML with hold music — used by hold_url on conference participants.
Must accept both GET and POST because Twilio may use either.

post.description:
Return TwiML with hold music — used by hold_url on conference participants.
Must accept both GET and POST because Twilio may use either.

Handle conference status callbacks (e.g. conference ended).
When conference ends, ensure all participant call legs are terminated.
Route inbound call: To (Twilio number) → AgentPhoneNumber → AgentProfile

Called by Twilio when <Dial> completes (agent answered then hung up,
agent rejected, agent didn't answer, or agent was busy).

DialCallStatus values: completed, busy, no-answer, failed, canceled
- completed: agent answered, call finished normally → hang up
- busy/no-answer/failed/canceled: agent didn't take the call → voicemail

Twilio calls this for every call state change.

On 'completed':
  1. DB update
  2. Redis cleanup
  3. RabbitMQ event
  4. Background: GCS upload + AI analysis pipeline

TwiML Application Voice URL handler.

Called by Twilio when device.connect() is invoked from the frontend.
Twilio sends form data with:
- To: destination number (from connect params)
- From: client identity (client:user_id)
- CallSid: the Twilio call SID
- Custom params: stream_sid (passed via device.connect({ params: {...} }))

Returns TwiML to set up media stream and dial the destination.

delete.description:
Org Admin deletes a supervisor AND all agents that supervisor created.
All Twilio numbers are released.
Org Admin deletes a specific agent (regardless of which supervisor created them).

Platform Admin deletes an entire organization:
  1. Delete all agents (releases all Twilio numbers)
  2. Delete all supervisors
  3. Delete all org admin users
  4. Deactivate / delete the Organization record

get.description: Get full details of an organization including all its users and agents.

post.description:
Manually trigger AI analysis for a call.

Can be called with:
- call_sid: look up call by Twilio SID
- call_id: look up call by internal UUID
- transcript: optional override (if not provided, uses DB transcript)

Analysis is run synchronously and result returned immediately.
Also saves result to DB.

get.description:
List all calls for the organization with GCS recording URLs.

Returns calls with fresh signed GCS URLs so recordings can be played directly.

post.description: Create a new reminder.

get.description: Get reminders for the current agent. Use ?today_only=true for today's reminders.

patch.description: Update a reminder (title, status, priority, etc.).
